content: Over recent years there’s been a growing population of rooks to complement the jackdaws, magpies, and crows in my neighbourhood(and very occasionally a jay in the nearby cemetery). I think the rooks are my favourite though. They’re extra shaggy and have interesting calls.

photo.alt: A rook perched in a telegraph line, seen from below and to the side. Its distinctive featherless white face and shaggy plumage leave no doubt that it’s a rook! Behind it is a cloudless blue sky.
